question_text: What is the most dependent portion of the abdominal cavity in a supine person?
Which of the following organs is NOT within the anterior pararenal space?
What is the maximal normal diameter of the abdominal aorta?
The following are true of the gastric rugae, EXCEPT?

options.A: They are absent in the pylorus.
options.B: They are more prominent in the body and fundus.
options.C: They measure 3 to 5 mm in thickness
options.D: They run parallel to the long axis of the stomach.

question_text: What is the most dependent portion of the stomach in supine position?
Based on Couinaud's segmental anatomy of the liver, what structure/s divides the liver into its four (4) longitudinal sections?
What is the major vascular supply to the liver?
The following is true of the accessory spleen, EXCEPT:

options.A: Arterial blood supply is directly from the aorta
options.C: Most commonly located in the region of the pancreatic tail

question_text: In the lateral view, which cardiac chamber is border-forming in the high posterior, subcarinal region?
Coronary artery dominance depends on which artery supplies the posterior descending artery and the posterior and inferior surface of the myocardium. In 85% of cases, this supply is provided by the:
In the right anterior oblique view, this structure lies posteriorly and is in direct contact with the barium-filled esophagus:
In the left anterior oblique view, this structure lies just above the right atrium:
This chamber is NOT border-forming in the right anterior oblique view:
In 20% of the population, there is a common origin of the:

options.B: Brachiocephalic and left common carotid arteries
options.D: Left common carotid and left subclavian arteries

question_text: Which is true about the right ventricle?

options.A: It forms the diaphragmatic surface of the heart.
options.B: It has thicker walls than the left ventricle.
options.C: It is more trabeculated than the left ventricle.
options.D: Septal papillary muscle is absent in this chamber.

question_text: Which is true regarding the posterior renal fascia?

options.B: It forms the posterior boundary of the anterior pararenal space.
options.C: It joins the fascia of the psoas muscle.
options.D: It separates into the retromesenteric plane.

question_text: Which space DOES NOT communicate across the midline?
Which is TRUE of the adrenal glands?

options.A: The right adrenal is lambda shaped while left is inverted V.
options.B: The right adrenal is more caudal than left.
options.C: They are composed of different tissues within same structure.
options.D: They lie above the perirenal space.

question_text: Which of the following DOES NOT directly supply blood to the adrenals?
Which is TRUE regarding blood supply to the kidneys?

options.A: Abdominal aorta commonly provides multiple blood supply to each kidney.
options.B: Adequate supply is ensured by anastomosis between segmental branches.
options.C: Interlobular arteries arise from arcuate arteries.
options.D: Segmental arteries pass dorsal to the renal pelvis.

question_text: Which structure is in close contact with left kidney?
Which is true of the testis on ultrasound?

options.A: It exhibits an echotexture similar to the thyroid.
options.B: It is covered by a dense fibrous capsule called tunica vaginalis.
options.C: It is isoechoic compared to the epididymis.
options.D: Its blood flow pattern is from the mediastinum going towards the testicular parenchyma.

question_text: What is the normal maximum distance in mm of the dens from anterior arch of C1 in adults?
The manubriosternal joint is an example of what type of cartilaginous articulation?
Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding the elbow fat pads?

options.A: The anterior fat pad is visible in flexion and extension lateral radiographs.
options.B: The elbow fat pads are extrasynovial and extracapsular in location.
options.C: The posterior fat pad normally is not visible in flexion lateral radiographs.
options.D: Visualization of the anterior fat pad in flexion lateral radiograph denotes a positive fat pad sign.

question_text: What is the site of attachment of the capsular ligament of the glenohumeral joint?
Which among the following is TRUE regarding the teardrop shadow in the hips?

options.A: It determines the acetabular coverage of the femoral head
options.B: It is used to detect abnormalities of acetabular depth and diagnose acetabular protrusion
options.C: The lateral aspect of the teardrop is the anteroinferior margin of the quadrilateral surface
options.D: The medial aspect of the teardrop is the wall of the acetabular fossa

question_text: Which ligament connects the laminae of adjacent vertebrae from the second cervical to the lumbosacral levels and permits separation of the laminae with flexion of the vertebral column?
Among the following statements regarding bone marrow, which is TRUE?

options.A: Cartilaginous epiphyses contain marrow in children
options.B: Marrow conversion is usually complete by the age of 40-45 years
options.C: Red marrow is found in the metaphysis of the humerus in adults and children
options.D: Red to yellow marrow conversion is more advanced in the more proximal bones of the extremities

question_text: Which tendon is NOT part of the rotator cuff of the shoulder joint?
What extra-cerebral CSF space exhibits a "Star of David" appearance on axial imaging?
What structure corresponds to the posterior pituitary bright spot seen on sagittal T1-weighted images of the sella?
What nerve root exits at the C7-T1 neural foramen?
Which of the following paranasal sinuses does NOT drain into the ostiomeatal unit?
In general, the adult spinal cord terminates normally at what level?
Which of the following is NOT a component of the Circle of Willis?
Which of the following cranial nerves is NOT contained within the cavernous sinus?
What structure divides the parotid gland into superficial and deep lobes?
Generally speaking, the only mediastinal line to be visualized with any regularity in the newborn and young infant is the:
A normal variant, intercostal bulging and apical herniation of the lungs seen in infants occur during which phase of respiration?
This represents the primary anti-reflux mechanism for the neonate:
In the neonate, gas in the stomach is usually first noted:

options.D: As soon as the infant begins breathing

question_text: Which is true regarding the normal neonatal adrenal gland?

options.B: Thick echogenic medulla surrounded by thin sonolucent cortex

question_text: Feature of normal periosteal new bone formation in premature infants that differentiate it from pathologic periosteal formation is:

options.A: Commonly seen in the bones of the forearms
options.B: Involves diaphysis and stops at metaphysis
options.C: More common at the lateral aspects of the shafts
options.D: Most pronounced at 6 months of age

question_text: The following synchondroses are usually obliterated by 2 years of age, EXCEPT:
"M" line of Cremin corresponds to the level of the:
Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding the trachea?

options.A: Coronal-to-sagittal diameter ratio of 0.6 is normal
options.B: Normal upper limit coronal tracheal diameter of 2.5 cm in women
options.D: Tracheoesophageal stripe thickness of 5 mm is normal

question_text: The tethering effect of this ligament on the lower lobe accounts for the medial location and triangular appearance of lower lobe collapse.
Edema of this interstitium accounts for Kerley B lines and thickened fissures in chest radiographs.
The Raider triangle is bordered by the following, EXCEPT:
The following is a TRUE statement regarding the diaphragm, its openings and potential gaps:

options.A: Aortic hiatus lies in the midline, anterior to the T10
options.B: Diaphragmatic crura originate from the upper lumbar vertebrae
options.C: Esophageal hiatus lies in the midline caudad to the aortic hiatus
options.D: Foramina of Bochdalek are triangular gaps in the anteromedial diaphragm.

question_text: Which of the following is TRUE of the pleura:

options.A: Blood supply to the visceral pleura is via the systemic circulation
options.B: Normal costal, diaphragmatic and mediastinal pleura is not visible on plain radiographs or CT
options.C: Parietal pleura is adherent to the lung
options.D: Visualization of the intercostal stripe on HRCT is an abnormal finding

question_text: Which of the following is NOT located in the posterior mediastinum?
In older women, most of the glandular tissue undergoes fatty involution in which part of the breast?
What structure is seen as a mammographic density near the medial aspect of the chest on a craniocaudal view which should not be mistaken for a mass?
Which normal part of the breast has an echogenic appearance on ultrasound?
Which part of the uterus varies in appearance with changes in the menstrual state:

Which of the following is TRUE regarding the size of the corpus and cervix in nulliparous women:

options.A: The corpus and cervix are of approximately equal length.
options.B: The corpus is about thrice the length of the cervix.
options.C: The corpus is about twice the length of the cervix.
options.D: The corpus is approximately one-half the length of the cervix.
